alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Hartley; Moore; Oldham; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 3:40PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Randall, Oldham, eastern Deaf Smith, western Potter, southwestern Moore and southern Hartley Counties through 430 PM CST... At 340 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Romero to 6 miles southeast of Adrian to near Summerfield. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hereford, Vega, Channing, Adrian, Buffalo Lake, Bushland, Dawn, Valley De Oro, Boys Ranch, Umbarger, Wildorado, and Simms. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
